heading: nokia: web, email via tv signal
subheading: the european wireless maker demonstrates a portable device that lets users surf the net, send email, and watch digital tv -- all via broadcast tv frequencies.
author: wired news report
text: european telecom giant nokia unveiled a wireless device that lets you watch tv, surf the web and send email.with a 12-inch lcd screen, the battery-operated mediascreen features a digital tv receiver that decodes regular tv transmissions and web pages encoded in the tv signal."this device enables interactive access to the internet and a selection of web pages offered by the broadcasting company within its digital signal stream, even for people on the move," said the company, in a statement."moreover, mediascreen makes it possible to send and receive electronic mail, watch television, and listen to the radio with digital quality."the mediascreen will go on sale in germany in 2001 for about us$1,200.reuters contributed to this report.
